benchmark_details.name: GRASP (Grid-Based Benchmark for Evaluating Commonsense Spatial Reasoning)
benchmark_details.overview: GRASP is a large-scale benchmark consisting of 16,000 grid-based environments designed to evaluate the commonsense spatial reasoning abilities of LLMs through energy collection tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To benchmark the commonsense spatial reasoning abilities of LLMs within structured grid environments.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The synthetic nature of GRASPâ€™s grid environments may not fully capture the complexity of real-world CSR tasks.

data.source: Generated grid environments based on defined parameters for energy distribution, obstacles, and agent constraints.

methods: Baseline comparison with random walk and greedy search methods
methodology.calculation: Performance is calculated based on the amount of energy collected and the number of steps taken by the agents.
methodology.interpretation: Higher energy collected and fewer steps taken indicate better performance.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-3.5-Turbo underperformed against both random walk and greedy search baselines.
methodology.validation: Results validated through statistical tests comparing agent performances.
